Pynacea documentation¶

Pynacea is a program that allows the user to run voice recognition software on a virtual machine and transcribe the result into their main operating system. Users may also create grammars, which contain rules that call user-defined functions upon triggering.

This project is similar to the Natlink/Dragonfly/Aenea stack. However, Pynacea does not hook into Dragon NaturallySpeaking. In exchange for losing the ability to send commands to NaturallySpeaking, this project hopefully gains stability and flexibility in that it does not require access to APIs from any proprietary voice recognition software, and can in fact run alongside any voice recognition program.
